inputs:
Q: Sarah has been working hard on her project for weeks, but she is still not satisfied with the result. She decides to take a break and come back to it later with fresh eyes. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: Rome wasn’t built in a day.
  choice: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
  choice: A watched pot never boils.
A:
targets: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
multiple_choice_targets: Rome wasn’t built in a day.
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
A watched pot never boils.

inputs:
Q: After years of saving money, Tom finally has enough to buy his dream car. However, he realizes that he doesn’t really need it and decides to invest the money instead. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: A penny saved is a penny earned.
  choice: You can’t have your cake and eat it too.
  choice: Money doesn’t grow on trees.
A:
targets: A penny saved is a penny earned.
multiple_choice_targets: You can’t have your cake and eat it too.
Money doesn’t grow on trees.
A penny saved is a penny earned.

inputs:
Q: Mary is trying to convince her boss to give her a raise. She prepares a list of all the extra responsibilities she has taken on and presents it to him. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: The squeaky wheel gets the grease.
  choice: Actions speak louder than words.
  choice: You can lead a horse to water, but you can’t make it drink.
A:
targets: The squeaky wheel gets the grease.
multiple_choice_targets: Actions speak louder than words.
You can lead a horse to water, but you can’t make it drink.
The squeaky wheel gets the grease.

inputs:
Q: After years of working in the same company, John decides to quit his job and start his own business. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
  choice: You can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs.
  choice: Fortune favors the bold.
A:
multiple_choice_targets: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
You can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs.
Fortune favors the bold.

inputs:
Q: When Max was applying for a new job after he got fired, he wrote his resume and cover letters so creatively that he got offered a copywriter job. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: Where one door shuts, another opens.
  choice: Where there is a will, there is a way.
  choice: You can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar.
A:
targets: Where one door shuts, another opens.
multiple_choice_targets: Where there is a will, there is a way.
Where one door shuts, another opens.
You can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar.

inputs:
Q: Mary was always complaining about her job, but she never tried to find a new one. One day, she got fired, and now she regrets not looking for other opportunities earlier. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: A penny saved is a penny earned.
  choice: You cannot judge a book by its cover.
  choice: Strike while the iron is hot.
  choice: Don’t count your chickens before they hatch.
A:
targets: Strike while the iron is hot.
multiple_choice_targets: Don’t count your chickens before they hatch.
You cannot judge a book by its cover.
A penny saved is a penny earned.
Strike while the iron is hot.

inputs:
Q: Tom was always procrastinating and leaving everything for the last minute. He failed his exams because he didn’t study enough. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: All good things come to those who wait.
  choice: A stitch in time saves nine.
  choice: Rome wasn’t built in a day.
  choice: Time and tide wait for no man.
A:
targets: Time and tide wait for no man.
multiple_choice_targets: All good things come to those who wait.
A stitch in time saves nine.
Rome wasn’t built in a day.
Time and tide wait for no man.

inputs:
Q: Jack was always boasting about his achievements, but when it came to actually doing something, he would back off. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: Actions speak louder than words.
  choice: The early bird catches the worm.
  choice: A picture is worth a thousand words.
  choice: You can lead a horse to water, but you cannot make it drink.
A:
multiple_choice_targets: The early bird catches the worm.
You can lead a horse to water, but you cannot make it drink.
Actions speak louder than words.
A picture is worth a thousand words.

inputs:
Q: Sarah was always complaining about her weight, but she never exercised or ate healthily. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
  choice: You reap what you sow.
  choice: The grass is always greener on the other side.
  choice: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
A:
multiple_choice_targets: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
The grass is always greener on the other side.
You reap what you sow.
A rolling stone gathers no moss.

inputs:
Q: John was always trying to please everyone and would often say yes to everything, even if he didn’t have time for it. He ended up being overwhelmed and not doing anything properly. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: Too many irons in the fire.
  choice: When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
  choice: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
  choice: Jack of all trades, master of none.
A:
targets: Jack of all trades, master of none.
multiple_choice_targets: Too many irons in the fire.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.
Jack of all trades, master of none.

inputs:
Q: Mary was always trying to control everything and everyone around her, but she ended up pushing people away. Which of the following proverbs best apply to this situation?
  choice: You can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs.
  choice: A leopard cannot change its spots.
  choice: Let sleeping dogs lie.
  choice: If you love someone, set them free.
A:
targets: If you love someone, set them free.
multiple_choice_targets: You can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs.
Let sleeping dogs lie.
A leopard cannot change its spots.
If you love someone, set them free.
